business.headline: The new trade playbook: Why the world needs a more distributed systemThese shifts are not driven by a single factor but by the combined influence of policy changes, supply chain lessons from recent years, and the evolving priorities of businesses and governments.

Investing Rs 5,000 every month in SIPs? This is when you can hit Rs 1 crorePeople know SIPs are useful, they hear stories of long-term gains, and they see friends investing every month, but when it comes to choosing where to put a small amount like Rs 5,000, most feel lost.

ED attaches Anil Ambani-linked assets worth Rs 1,400 crore; total nears Rs 9,000 croreThe latest attachment has been made under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The properties are located across Navi Mumbai, Chennai, Pune and Bhubaneswar, the sources said.

Considering a personal loan for holiday travel? Ask these 5 questions firstFunding that year-end getaway through an instant personal loan might seem like a savvy move, but it is important to assess the need thoroughly. An impulsive decision may be overshadowing some important financial realities.

JP Power share price zooms 10%. Why is it rising today?JP Power, which was trading at Rs 22.37, gained over 10% in early trade as investors reacted to clarity on the future of the JP Group's stressed assets. JAL, the former promoter entity, holds close to 24% stake in JP Power.

Groww shares down 8% again: Why Billionbrains stock is falling todayGroww has been under pressure for two consecutive days. On Wednesday, the stock had already slipped around 10%. This comes after the company made a strong market debut, listing at Rs 112, about 12% higher than its issue price of Rs 100.

Sensex rises over 150 points, Nifty crosses 26,000; Groww shares tumble 7%The S&P BSE Sensex climbed over 150 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 moved past the 26,000 mark, signalling a mildly bullish undertone across the market. Broader indices also edged higher, mirroring gains in frontline stocks.

When missed EMIs become a nightmare: Inside India's loan harassment trapBehind India's digital lending rise is a quieter story of calls, pressure and fear. Data suggests that loan recovery harassment is growing at a pace the system can no longer keep up with.
Sensex ends 500 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; HCLTech gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 513.45 points to close at 85,186.47, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 142.60 points to end at 26,052.65.

Big fat Indian weddings can now be insured. Should you get one?India is gearing up for one of its busiest wedding seasons ever. In 2025 alone, nearly 46 lakh weddings are expected, generating close to Rs 6.5 lakh crore in spending.

He lost Rs 40,000: Expert explains how online gaming apps trap usersExpert says insiders from gaming firms have revealed how these apps operate. They label heavy spenders as "whales" and have teams calling them daily to push more deposits.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPExcelsoft Technologies aims to raise Rs 500 crore through the IPO, which includes a fresh issue of 1.50 crore shares worth Rs 180 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.67 crore shares worth Rs 320 crore.

Wrong member ID linked to your UAN? Here's how EPFO lets you fix itMany employees discover that their UAN has been linked to a wrong member ID, often due to job changes or data errors. EPFO has introduced an easy online method to fix this, without visiting any office.

How every day micro-payments eat into your savingsWelcome to India's new spending reality, the age of micro-payments that silently seep into your accounts and cause invisible leaks. By the end of the month, many people find their digital wallets, likePaytm, PhonePe, Google Pay, have quietly leaked hundreds and thousands of rupees.

NCR office rents are rising: What's driving commercial real estate prices up?Expressway expansions, metro lines, and upcoming airports are easing mobility while opening new economic opportunities in the NCR.

Groww shares crash 10% to hit lower circuit. Why are investors booking profits?The share price of Groww fell 10% in early trade and slipped straight to the lower circuit, a sharp contrast to the over 90% rally investors had witnessed over the past few days.

Government to release new ITR forms by January 2026. How will they impact taxpayers?What will the new ITR forms, expected by January 2026, mean for ordinary taxpayers as India shifts to the updated Income Tax Act, 2025? Have a look here.
Tenneco Clean Air Share Price: Stock makes strong debut at 27% premiumTenneco Clean Air shares listed at Rs 505 on the NSE and Rs 498 on the BSE, compared with its issue price of Rs 397.

Groww shares slump 10% after massive post-listing rally. Why is it falling today?After four straight sessions of runaway gains, the stock finally cooled off on Wednesday, down sharply in early trade. At around 9:50 am, shares of the company were down 10% to Rs 169.89 on the NSE.
Waaree Energies share price falls over 5%. Why is it down today?The stock slipped 4.26% to Rs 3,143.20 on the BSE in the opening minutes and later extended losses to trade 5.6% lower at Rs 3,089.

entertainment.headline: Sushmita Sen gets special birthday wish from Charu Asopa: Age bows down to you Charu Asopa shared a heartfelt birthday message for Sushmita Sen, lovingly calling her daughter Ziana's "sexy bua" and praising her beauty, wisdom, and grace. The post stood out among the many wishes the actor received as she celebrated her birthday on November 19.

Homebound OTT release: When and where to watch India's Oscar entry Homebound, India's official Oscar entry, will stream on Netflix from November 21. Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, the film stars Vishal Jethwa, Ishaan Khatter and Janhvi Kapoor.

Mastiii 4: Censor board cuts animal sex scene, words 'behen' and item replaced 'Mastiii 4' received an A certificate after the Central Board of Film Certification required a set of limited cuts and changes to dialogue and visuals. The film is headlined by Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh.

Kufar: Diljit Dosanjh's choreographers defend dance moves amid objectification row Choreographers of Diljit Dosanjh's recent track 'Kufar' addressed social media backlash over the song, citing intent behind dance moves and defending their artistic vision.

Why is Alia Bhatt missing from Dining With the Kapoors? Armaan Jain clarifies Alia Bhatt is missing from Netflix's 'Dining With the Kapoors'. The show's  due to work commitments. This absence has sparked curiosity among fans about the family gathering.

Keerthy Suresh breaks silence on her AI morphed images: It's hurting, irritating Actor Keerthy Suresh shared her concern over AI-generated altered images of herself circulating online, expressing emotional distress and highlighting broader challenges posed by artificial intelligence.

Arjun Rampal refuses to explain Dhurandhar torture scene: Won't talk about that The trailer for upcoming film 'Dhurandhar' drew attention for its graphic violence and cast revelations during its Mumbai launch event. Arjun Rampal addressed a question about the violent scene in the trailer featuring him, but didn't really address it.

Perfect Family trailer: Humorous yet emotional take on therapy and family dynamics The trailer of Perfect Family, India's first paid YouTube long-format series, has been released. The show, produced by Pankaj Tripathi, promises a humorous yet emotional take on family therapy and mental health stigma.

Karan Johar on his need for love: You get loneliest in your highs, not your lows Karan Johar opened up on Sania Mirza's podcast about feeling lonely despite accepting his singlehood, admitting he once deeply longed for companionship. The filmmaker said he would still embrace love "with arms wide like Shah Rukh Khan's" if it ever came his way.

Actor couple Varun Badola, Rajeshwari Sachdev on reuniting after 20 years in Co-Ed Real-life couple Varun Badola and Rajeshwari Sachdev reunite on-screen after 20 years. In an exclusive interview, the actor duo opened up about their series 'Co-Ed', their characters and much more.

Tara Sutaria shares kiss and hug with Veer Pahariya on her 30th birthday. Watch Actor Tara Sutaria marked her 30th birthday with an intimate celebration in the Maldives, joined by her boyfriend, Veer Pahariya. A video from the private celebrations has emerged online.

Nandamuri Balakrishna screams at fan, instructs security: Don't let him near me Actor-politician Nandamuri Balakrishna's recent interaction with fans at Visakhapatnam airport during promotional activities for 'Akhanda 2' has drawn attention after a video showed him losing his temper with a fan.

De De Pyaar De 2 box office Day 6: Ajay Devgn' film nears Rs 50 crore-mark Ajay Devgn's film maintains steady box office momentum, with 'De De Pyaar De 2' approaching the Rs 50 crore milestone after six days of release. The film has been supported by improving occupancy and positive audience feedback.

Kriti Sanon's 'stupid' confession on rumoured boyfriend Kabir's birthday Kriti Sanon shared an unseen vacation picture to wish her rumoured boyfriend Kabir Bahia on his birthday, calling him "the one I can be stupid with." While the actor keeps her relationship private, her warm post and frequent appearances with Kabir continue to spark speculation.

Champagne Problems review: Minka Kelly's film is a delightful Christmas watchRelease Date:Wed Nov 19, 2025 Netflix's Champagne Problems, starring Minka Kelly and Tom Wozniczka, is a festive romantic comedy set in Paris. Is the one-hour, 39-minute-long movie worth your time? Find out here.

Travis Scott lights up Mumbai debut concert with bold sonic spectacle. Videos Travis Scott performed his first concert in Mumbai, thrilling thousands of fans. The high-energy show marked a significant moment in India's growing presence on the global music tour circuit.

Travis Scott's Mumbai show: Water sprayed on crowd as heat grips venue US rapper Travis Scott performed in Mumbai on Wednesday, just a month after his first show in India. Amid all the viral videos from the concert, a clip of security spraying water on the crowd to combat the city's heat has caught the attention of all.

SS Rajamouli and atheism: Tracing his complex relationship with religion Director SS Rajamouli landed in trouble for his atheist and Lord Hanuman remarks at the 'Varanasi' event. But, did you know that he has spoken about being an atheist several times in the past?

Kangana Ranaut visits Dwarkadhish, calls experience deeply peaceful and divine Kangana Ranaut visited the Dwarkadhish Temple during her Gujarat trip, sharing serene moments from her darshan and expressing how the experience left her feeling peaceful and divine.

general news.headline: Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for record 10th time, PM present LIVE UPDATESNitish Kumar was sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record 10th time at Patna's Gandhi Maidan, with PM Modi and several NDA Chief Ministers in attendance.

No timeline for Governors to clear bills, but long delay can invite review: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court said that Governors cannot sit on bills indefinitely, even as it was not in favour of fixed timelines for granting assent. While highlighting the separation of powers, the court said prolonged delays in clearing bills could still be subjected to judicial scrutiny.

PM Modi called me: Trump's new claim on India-Pak conflict has '350%' twistRepeating the claim for the nth time, Trump said he settled the conflict between India and Pakistan after threatening the two countries with 350% tariffs. He also claimed that PM Modi called him to say India was not going to war.
I'm a doctor going through perimenopause, and here's exactly how I'm managing itA dermatologist's first-hand journey through the science, skin, and soul of hormonal change - perimenopause.

The Hoogly googly: Why BJP hits a wall in West BengalPM Modi might use the Ganga metaphor to talk about an electoral victory in Bengal after Bihar, but geography itself throws up a Hoogly googly. On the demographic back foot in West Bengal, the BJP's problem is how does it dislodge Mamata Banerjee, who hasn't lodged herself as the CM even after 14 years, playing the eternal opposition to a "scheming Dilli"?

Discretion yes, paralysis no: What Supreme Court said on timeline to clear billsA five-judge bench headed by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai said prescribing deadlines would "violate the elasticity available under the Constitution," but it also warned governors against deliberately taking no action at all.

Is interstellar comet 3I/Atlas an alien spaceship? Nasa breaks silenceThe comet, discovered on July 1, 2025, has sparked unprecedented interest, prompting Nasa to coordinate a solar system-wide observation campaign.

9 stints as CM, many switches: Nitish Kumar's endless game of thrones in BiharNitish Kumar's political journey is a masterclass in survival, marked by dramatic alliance switches that have never once pushed him off Bihar's throne. Now headed for a record tenth term, he remains the state's most enduring and predictable power player.

Foreign tourists' Chunari Chunari dance at Rajasthan petrol pump is a superhit videoIt all began when the driver of a tractor parked at the petrol pump turned up the volume on Chunari Chunari. The desi beats delighted the foreign tourists, who couldn't resist breaking into an impromptu dance.

Investing Rs 5,000 every month in SIPs? This is when you can hit Rs 1 crorePeople know SIPs are useful, they hear stories of long-term gains, and they see friends investing every month, but when it comes to choosing where to put a small amount like Rs 5,000, most feel lost.

Willing to take MAGA heat: Trump backs foreign workers amid H-1B visa rowUS H1B visas: Trump's emphatic pitch for foreign workers, even as his administration tightens rules around the H1-B visa programme, has angered his MAGA supporters.

Bihar BJP chief Dilip Jaiswal gets cabinet post. Full list of 27 ministersAlong with Nitish Kumar, 14 leaders from the BJP, eight from the Janata Dal (United), two from the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas), and one each from the Hindustani Awam Morcha and Rashtriya Lok Morcha were sworn in as ministers.

Why the viral Raulane photos turned into a nightmare for the photographersTheir photos spread like wildfire, introducing a little-known village festival to the world. But instead of feeling proud, the photographers stayed up night after night, fighting for the one thing that should've come easily: credit.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Donate my organs: Delhi teen's last wish before suicide after prolonged harassmentFollowing his death, India Today reached out to his parents, and the victim's father claimed that his son was upset regarding the treatment he received in school.

China uses economic might against Japan on Taiwan issue, bans seafood importsChina has imposed a full ban on Japanese seafood imports after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi linked the Taiwan conflict to Japan's security. The move, amid tensions over Taiwan and the disputed Senkaku islands, hits Japan's fishing industry hard, which is still recovering from China's earlier ban.

Cristiano Ronaldo thanks Trump after getting golden key at White House dinnerPortugal superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has thanked United States President Donald Trump for inviting him to the White House, where he was presented with a symbolic golden key.

Can rabies spread through milk? Here are the factsAround 170 people in Gorakhpur rushed to hospitals for rabies vaccination after consuming 'panchamrit' reportedly prepared with milk from a rabid cow. The scare follows reports of a Greater Noida woman's death from rabies after she drank infected milk. But can milk from a cow with rabies infect humans? Here are the facts.

Trump signs bill to force release of Epstein files, calls out Democrat 'hoax'Trump announced the move in a lengthy Truth Social post, casting the release of the Epstein files as a transparency win for his administration. He also played up the paedophile financier's ties to Democrats.

Is Trump turning to Modinomics with his baby accounts and tariff payouts?With midterms nearing and Republicans' control of Congress at stake, US President Donald Trump appears to be drawing from PM Modi's playbook of economic welfarism, implementing direct transfers to targeted beneficiaries such as babies and non–high-income Americans.

Meghalaya cab driver's swag while vibing to Eminem hit is the energy you need todayIn the viral video, the Meghalaya cab driver is seen parked by the roadside, enjoying a moment to himself as he vibes enthusiastically to Eminem's hit track Without Me playing inside his car.

Telangana Governor approves prosecution of KT Rama Rao in Formula E race caseThe Telangana Governor approved the ACB's request to prosecute K T Rama Rao in the Formula E race case involving alleged irregular payments of Rs 55 crore. The ACB plans to proceed with a charge sheet. KTR earlier denied wrongdoing and said he was ready for a lie-detector test.

Keerthy Suresh breaks silence on her AI morphed images: It's hurting, irritatingActor Keerthy Suresh shared her concern over AI-generated altered images of herself circulating online, expressing emotional distress and highlighting broader challenges posed by artificial intelligence.

Won't run away: DK Shivakumar's response to CM chants amid power swap buzzDK Shivakumar, who is also the Karnataka Congress state president, made the remarks amid ongoing speculation about a change in the chief ministerial post as the incumbent government is approaching the halfway mark of its five-year term this month.

Sushmita Sen gets special birthday wish from Charu Asopa: Age bows down to youCharu Asopa shared a heartfelt birthday message for Sushmita Sen, lovingly calling her daughter Ziana's "sexy bua" and praising her beauty, wisdom, and grace. The post stood out among the many wishes the actor received as she celebrated her birthday on November 19.

Mastiii 4: Censor board cuts animal sex scene, words 'behen' and item replaced'Mastiii 4' received an A certificate after the Central Board of Film Certification required a set of limited cuts and changes to dialogue and visuals. The film is headlined by Vivek Oberoi, Aftab Shivdasani and Riteish Deshmukh.

sports.headline: No 2.5 day lottery, Gill replacement: Chopra on India's to-do list for 2nd Test Aakash Chopra has revealed what India will need to do ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati. Chopra also named the player that India should use to replace Shubman Gill in the lineup.

Cadillac F1 not going to settle for a long-term back-grid role, says Graeme Lowdon Graeme Lowdon says Cadillac F1 will enter the 2026 season focused on execution and rapid development, insisting the new team has no intention of settling into a long-term back-grid position despite the challenges of joining Formula One.

Cristiano Ronaldo thanks Trump after getting golden key at White House dinner Portugal superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has thanked United States President Donald Trump for inviting him to the White House, where he was presented with a symbolic golden key.

Manoj Tiwary questions BCCI selectors over lack of communication with Mohammed Shami Manoj Tiwary has criticised the BCCI selectors for poor communication regarding Mohammed Shami's exclusion from the Indian team, questioning why a senior pacer was not directly consulted despite his strong domestic performances.

Gambhir having a go at India players with his Eden pitch remarks: AB de Villiers Former South Africa captain AB de Villiers believes Gautam Gambhir indirectly criticised the Indian players after the Eden Gardens Test defeat, saying the coach's remarks on the pitch hinted at dissatisfaction with the team's batting.

SC-appointed Justice Rao calls for AIFF reforms to revive ISL bidding Justice (Retd) L Nageswara Rao, in his report to the Supreme Court, has recommended striking a balance between preserving the autonomy of the All India Football Federation (AIFF) and safeguarding the commercial interests of prospective bidders, following the unsuccessful tender process to monetise India's top football league.

Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim becomes 11th batter to score hundred in his 100th Test BAN vs IRE: Mushfiqur Rahim slammed a century on his 100th Test match as the veteran wicketkeeper-batter continues to make history for Bangladesh's Test team.

Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif in trouble for criticising Mohsin Naqvi's PCB Pakistan's cybercrime agency has launched a probe against former captain Rashid Latif over his comments criticising the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) and its chief Mohsin Naqvi for frequently changing the national team's captains.

Australia name playing XI for 1st Test, hand debuts to Weatherald and Dogget Ashes: Australia handed Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett their Test debuts in the Perth opener. Weatherald is expected to walk out alongside Usman Khawaja at the top of the order, while Doggett comes in as the third pacer.

PSG defender Achraf Hakimi crowned African Footballer of the Year Paris Saint-Germain and Morocco defender Achraf Hakimi has been named African Footballer of the Year after a treble-winning season, leading a night of Moroccan dominance at the CAF Awards in Rabat.

Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim becomes 11th batter to score hundred in his 100th Test BAN vs IRE: Mushfiqur Rahim slammed a century on his 100th Test match as the veteran wicketkeeper-batter continues to make history for Bangladesh's Test team.

Weatherald is expected to walk out alongside Usman Khawaja at the top of the order, while Doggett comes in as the third pacer.

Gambhir era turning pitches: The great leveller for visiting spinnersIndia's recent loss in Kolkata has once again laid bare their frailties against spin on vicious turning tracks. Over the past 12 months, there has been a major shift in power with regard to visiting spinners in India, who have finally seemed to crack the code on how to tame Indian batters on their home soil.

Ashes: Can Joe Root conquer the Australia frontier to silence critics?Ashes 2025: Joe Root has yet to score a Test century in Australia, and he will be aiming to conquer this final frontier when the five-match Ashes series begins on November 21 at Perth Stadium. England have not won an Ashes Test in Australia since 2011.

Rafael Nadal back on court 12 months after retirement, practises with ex-studentA year after retiring, Rafael Nadal returned to the court to practice with rising star Alexandra Eala, celebrating her rapid rise in tennis while sharing a joyful moment with his former academy student.

Harbhajan Singh shakes hands with Pakistan bowler in Abu Dhabi T10 league, see picsFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh shook hands with Pakistan's Shahnawaz Dahani during the Abu Dhabi T10 League after his team's narrow loss to Northern Warriors at the Zayed Cricket Stadium.

Enough of experiments, India need stability to revive Test cricket: Manoj TiwaryFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary feels that the current team need to bring back stability in their Test squad to rise above recent losses. India lost the first Test against South Africa by 30 runs and are in danger of losing their 2nd successive series at home.

Shubman Gill in doubt for ODI series, set to miss 2nd Test vs South Africa: SourcesIND vs SA, 2nd Test: Shubman Gill is unlikely to make the cut for the Guwahati Test due to a neck injury that he sustained in the series opener at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata and might also end up missing the ODI series.

Virat, Rohit wanted to save Test cricket but quit due to bad atmosphere: TiwaryFormer cricketer Manoj Tiwary claims Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were forced to retire from Test cricket due to a poor team environment. Both stalwarts announced their retirement from the longest format earlier this year ahead of the England tour.

Afghanistan U19 stun India B U19 in One-Day tri-series after Abdul Aziz hat-trickAfghanistan U19 stunned India B U19 by 71 runs as Abdul Aziz's six-wicket haul, including a hat-trick, dismantled the chase after a modest 168 on Wednesday in Bengaluru. Yuvraj Gohil scored an unbeaten 60, but her efforts went in vain.

India lost the first Test against South Africa by 30 runs and are in danger of losing their 2nd successive series at home.

Both stalwarts announced their retirement from the longest format earlier this year ahead of the England tour.

Yuvraj Gohil scored an unbeaten 60, but her efforts went in vain.

FIDE World Cup: Arjun falls to Wei Yi as India's campaign ends in quarterfinalsArjun Erigaisi's defeat to China's Wei Yi in the quarterfinal tiebreak marked the end of India's run at the FIDE World Cup 2025. Despite drawing both classical games and showing resilience in rapid tiebreaks, Arjun could not overcome Wei's strong play, bringing the Indian challenge to a close.

Lizelle Lee trolled with distasteful comments after wicketkeeping blooper in WBBLLizelle Lee faced a wave of distasteful online trolling after a rare wicketkeeping blunder in the Hurricanes–Strikers WBBL clash despite her distinguished record as one of the league's most prolific performers.

Pandya, Bumrah likely to skip SA ODIs, with T20 World Cup approaching: ReportBoth Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah are reportedly set to skip the ODI series against South Africa, keeping themselves fully focused for the T20 World Cup that is set to take place in 2026.

Pat Cummins ready for Perth Test? Starc jokes about skipper's availabilityAustralia captain Pat Cummins is ruled out of the first Ashes Test due to injury but shows positive signs of recovery. Australia to take on England in the first Test of Ashes 2025-26 on November 21.

Has Gautam Gambhir overengineered India into a Test crisis?India's home aura is fading fast, and the questions are no longer whispers. With four home defeats in six Tests and the team drifting without clarity, Gautam Gambhir's bold ideas face a harsher truth: is he really the man to lead India's red-ball rebuild?

Harmanpreet Kaur on fire, expected to triple brand deals after World Cup gloryHarmanpreet Kaur's Women's World Cup win has sparked a surge in brand interest, with her endorsements set to triple as companies increasingly embrace women's cricket and its empowering narrative.

Venkatesh Iyer hopes for KKR return despite release: Still want to play for themIPL 2026: Venkatesh Iyer expressed his desire to continue with KKR despite being released, saying he remains open to any IPL team while highlighting his readiness to contribute with batting, bowling and leadership.

ICC U19 World Cup 2026 to begin on January 15, India, Pakistan not in same groupThe ICC has released the schedule for the Men's Under-19 Cricket World Cup 2026, which will take place in Zimbabwe and Namibia. Sixteen teams will compete in 41 matches, with Tanzania making their debut. However, there won't be any India vs Pakistan fixture in the group stage.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
